patterns: What words should I add
should i add every words I don't know
how do I know what words to add when sentence mining
responses:
What words to make cards from and add to your Anki is a skill that gets better over time. But in short, there are two things you want to keep in mind.

1. How useful do you think the word is. You can use your instincts on this. Obviously, words dealing with complex surgical procedures if you aren't a surgeon or physics terminology if you don't often talk about or engage in physics content would not be that useful. But if you look at the word, figure out what it means, and feel it's a word worth knowing and could be common, then go ahead and add it. If you were wrong about its usefulness later, you can always suspend/delete the card. Or if you pass it up and feel you are wrong, you can add it later. Any word worth learning, you will come across more than once. So don't worry about missing out on a word.

2. If the above criteria is met, then the next thing you want to consider is, do you feel you will remember it the next time you see it. As you get more of a foundation, you'll start to notice that some words just seem to stick. Or are similar to another word you know, and you may feel you don't need the SRS to remember it. Only add a word to the SRS if you feel you need the SRS to remember it. But if you get the feeling that you might remember it without Anki, then don't add it and instead focus on adding words you feel the benefit from adding to your flashcards.

patterns: does sentence mining count as immersion
is sentence mining immersion
responses: This depends on how you are doing it. If you are using morphman to find sentences (not recommended), then no, this is not immersion. If you sentence mine how we recommend, then yes, it is immersion. Some people see sentence mining as an individual activity. In reality, sentence mining and immersion are one and the same. You don't necessarily want to go into your immersion with a focus on looking for sentences. Instead, you want to focus on understanding your immersion. During that process, you will naturally come across sentences where you think to yourself "Oh man, I almost understood that. What prevented me from understanding it?". In these moments, you can go back and investigate with a dictionary. If the sentence is a perfect 1T sentence, a sentence where you can fully understand it once you know that 1 unknown element, you can add it to Anki. So, in reality, sentence mining is a bi-product of immersion and trying to understand your immersion.

Can I start sentence mining after words
responses: We recommend going through a premade vocabulary foundation deck, such as the Refold JP1K, before sentence mining. This foundation will make sentence mining much more accessible. However, if you are motivated to start mining early and find perfect 1T sentence cards, you are more than welcome to start whenever you want. Just be careful about taking on too much too quickly, as learning the tools for sentence mining has a bit of a learning curve.

patterns: Should I mine vocabulary or sentences
should i sentence mine or vocabulary mine
sentence mining or vocab mining
responses: You should almost always mine sentences. Other than very conreat words like "Red" or "chair", you almost always want the context you encoutnered the word in, and even with concreat words like red, it's probably best to take the sentence anyway just to have it. With that being said, while you always want the sentence, the context, what type of card you make from the data you collect (the word, definition, audio, sentence, etc), is up to you. You can make a vocab card, a sentence card, whatever you want. See related question for more info on the type of cards you can make.

can i just use premade deck
do you need to do sentence mining
is sentence mining nessesary
Do I need to sentence mine
do i need to do sentence mining
responses:
Sentence mining is not essential. Some people don't even ever use Anki, and others will use large premade decks. However, we very much recommend against this and highly recommend sentence mining for many reasons.

1. Avoiding Anki altogether will likely make the process take much longer. Anki is great at priming things in your mind so that you can acquire them faster in immersion.

2. Premade decks, in our experience, are vastly inferior to sentence mining. There are many reasons for this, but here is one main reason. When you sentence mine, you are actively taking words from the content you enjoy. This will increase the likelihood that you will come across those words again sooner rather than later, which also increases the rate at which you will acquire those words. This increases the rate at which your snowball grows (see related questions) and dramatically speeds up your progress. A short investment in learning the tools to sentence mine will pay dividends in the long run and save you a lot of time compared to relying on premade decks too much. (Most also find that sentence mining helps words stick better than finding even the same word in a premade deck because you understand the full context)
Related-Q: What is the snowball effect?  /  How do I sentence mine?
